modules.description: The module provides low-level operations to manipulate packet metadata, including flags, timestamps, stream indices, and side data, along with functions for duplicating packets and converting them to byte representations. It works with data structures like multimedia packets, parsers, and metadata types to enable detailed control over audio/video stream processing. Use cases include media encoding, decoding, and streaming applications requiring precise packet management.

This module provides functions for handling audio codec configurations, including retrieving descriptors, listing IDs, and selecting encoders/decoders by name or ID. It operates on codec objects and audio parameters to query metadata like channel layouts, sample rates, and bit rates, enabling tasks such as configuring audio processing pipelines and optimizing encoding settings. Specific use cases include managing diverse audio formats and ensuring compatibility across different codec requirements.

The module offers functions to retrieve and manage video codec configurations, including encoder/decoder settings, frame rate constraints, and pixel format details, while enabling the creation of codec instances. It works with structured data like codec identifiers, video parameters, and configuration records to extract specific attributes such as resolution and bit rate. Use cases include configuring video processing pipelines, validating format compatibility, and optimizing encoding settings for specific hardware or streaming requirements.

Provides functions to retrieve codec descriptors, list available subtitle codecs by ID, and access encoders and decoders by name or ID. Works with subtitle codec IDs, codec parameters, and mode-specific codec structures. Used to identify and instantiate subtitle encoding/decoding processes for formats like SRT, ASS, and DVB.

Provides functions to convert codec identifiers to their string representations and extract codec IDs from parameter structures. Works with a custom `id` type representing various codec identifiers and a polymorphic `t` type parameterized by mode. Used to map internal codec representations to human-readable names and extract codec information from configuration data.

Provides functions to initialize, manage, and process data through a series of filters using packet-based input and output. Operates on filter configurations and packet structures, handling data flow between them. Used to apply transformations like encoding, decoding, or format conversion in multimedia processing pipelines.

Provides functions for decoding video streams, extracting frame data, and managing audio samples. Works with raw byte buffers, video frames, and audio packets from FFmpeg. Enables real-time video processing and audio synchronization in multimedia applications.

manages multimedia codecs with low-level packet manipulation, audio/video configuration, and subtitle handling. It supports operations on packets, codec descriptors, and filter chains, enabling precise control over encoding, decoding, and format conversion. Users can retrieve codec metadata, manage stream parameters, and apply transformations to audio, video, and subtitle streams. Examples include configuring video resolution, extracting audio bit rates, and converting subtitle formats within a processing pipeline.
